faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.description: Find answers to common questions about Math Star.

questions.question: Are there any age regulations for Math Star?
questions.answer: Yes. Math Star is safe for children of any age. However, for legal reasons, you must be older than 16 years to sign up for Math Star. Children under the age of 16 must use an account created by their parents.

questions.question: Is Math Star for free?
questions.answer: Yes and no. You can create an account for free and use the addition area without any payments. However, to unlock the subtraction, multiplication and division areas you must have a subscription.

questions.question: How does a Math Star subscription work?
questions.answer: By subscribing you get access to all Math Star features for one month. You can renew your subscription manually or choose our automatic renewal service. Subscription can only be made by users of legal age and in accordance with the guidelines of our financial provider Stripe.

questions.question: How do I cancel a subscription?
questions.answer: Subscriptions end automatically after one month. You do not have to cancel! If you have activated our automatic renewal service, simply turn it off with one click and your subscription runs out at the end of your current one-month plan. If you wish to cancel within the 3-day trial period, simply click the button "Cancel Subscription" on your dashboard.

questions.question: Can I track my child's progress?
questions.answer: Yes, the dashboard provides a progress overview and insights into your child's learning journey. Our star rewards show you how many stars your child has collected. Each star represents one correct answer.

questions.question: On which devices does Math Star work?
questions.answer: Math Star works on any device with a web browser, including desktops, laptops, tablets, and smartphones. For the best experience, however, we recommend devices with a larger screen.
